text:
Question 69) The most serious symptoms of flu a, caused by the H1N1 virus, were presented by older people and pregnant women. The apparent reason is the lowest immunity of these groups against the virus. To increase population immunity related to flu virus, the Brazilian government distributed vaccines to the most susceptible groups.
The H1N1 vaccine, as well as any other vaccine against infectious diseases, increases people's immunity because
A) It has antibodies against the causative agent of the disease.
B) has proteins that eliminate the causative agent of the disease.
C) stimulates the production of red blood cells through the bone marrow.
D) has lymphocytes B and T that neutralize the causative agent of the disease.
E) stimulates the production of antibodies against the causative agent of the disease.
